channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: Covid-19 live: Waikato cases linked to existing cluster, decision on alert levels today
item.description: Early tests have found a link between three Waikato Covid-19 cases and an existing cluster, as Cabinet meets to decide alert levels for Auckland and the rest of the country.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Covid 19: What do we know about today's alert level decision?
item.description: ANALYSIS: It is difficult not to see Auckland heading down to level 3, but as positive case numbers linger one question remains: will level 3 get it done?
item.dc:creator: LUKE MALPASS

item.title: Covid-19: Three people test positive for virus in Waikato
item.description: Three household members of a remand prisoner have returned positive Covid-19 tests and two of them attend Mangatangi School on the Hauraki Plains.
item.dc:creator: AUCKLAND REPORTERS

item.title: Covid-19: Cabinet could make ‘cautious' alert level decision to extend Auckland lockdown, adding Waikato, expert says
item.description: Professor Michael Baker says Cabinet might take the cautious approach to extend Auckland's lockdown for another week and add parts of the Waikato after household members of a remand prisoner tested positive in the region — including a pupil who was symptomatic at school.
item.dc:creator: COLLETTE DEVLIN

item.title: Scott Dixon's IndyCar title hopes over
item.description: Frustrating season continues for defending champion who struggles in penultimate race in California.
item.dc:creator: STUFF SPORTS REPORTERS

item.title: Covid 19: Hope fading as MIQ line hits 25,000 for 3000 spots
item.description: The new virtual lobby has only just gone live, but already more than 25,000 people are in the queue for limited spots in managed isolation.
item.dc:creator: TOM HUNT

item.title: Dua Lipa announces New Zealand tour for 2022
item.description: The English singer-songwriter - one of the biggest artists in the world right now - is heading Down Under to play one show on our shores next year.
item.dc:creator: DAVID SKIPWITH

item.title: Neighbour braves burning house to save 6-year-old girl
item.description: “No-one was around. I thought, I will just do this,” says a neighbour who climbed into a blazing house to save a child's life.
item.dc:creator: FRANCES CHIN AND BRADEN FASTIER

item.title: Silky Otter aims to take boutique cinema to the next level in Christchurch
item.description: A new eight-screen boutique cinema in Christchurch is now operating under level 2 pandemic restrictions after a gala opening was postponed by last month's lockdown.
item.dc:creator: CHARLIE GATES

item.title: Tiny Fest brings dance, music, performance art and fringe theatre to Chch
item.description: Festival returns to Christchurch to fill a gap left by the demise of many arts events.
item.dc:creator: CHARLIE GATES

item.title: Ros Benson went from Simply The Best to looking after the rest (of Picton)
item.description: Ros Benson came to Marlborough looking for adventure. Since then, she's owned a lodge, changed the water taxi game and set up an emergency centre.
item.dc:creator: CHLOE RANFORD LOCAL DEMOCRACY REPORTER

item.title: Greyhounds As Pets celebrates 15th birthday in style
item.description: A charity that rehomes greyhounds after racing has celebrating its milestone 15th birthday with a national walk for hundreds of hounds.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTCHURCH REPORTER

item.title: Playful fashion for when you need a joyful and fun purchase
item.description: After tough times, you deserve a little treat.
item.dc:creator: ZOE WALKER AHWA

item.title: Covid-19: Auckland supermarkets added to locations of interest, no Waikato locations thus far
item.description: A number of supermarkets and a health centre are among the latest locations of interest relating to the Delta outbreak of Covid-19.
item.dc:creator: MINA KERR-LAZENBY

item.title: Aimee Fisher wins world canoe sprint title after walking away from Tokyo Olympics selection
item.description: New Zealand now have the fastest K1 500m paddlers on the planet after Aimee Fisher's world title follows Lisa Carrington's gold medal.
item.dc:creator: STUFF SPORTS REPORTERS

item.title: Plastics campaigner alarmed by face masks littering city, beaches
item.description: A Taranaki woman is offering to sew masks for people who can’t find an alternative to using disposable masks.
item.dc:creator: CATHERINE GROENESTEIN

item.title: Covid-19: Police investigating door-to-door vaccination scam
item.description: Two men are going door-to-door in a Covid vaccine booking scam, trying to charge people $100 for vaccines that should be free.
item.dc:creator: LIZ MCDONALD

item.title: 'Awful' Springboks hammered at home as they seek redemption against All Blacks
item.description: Boks star accuses "street smart" Wallabies of dubious tactics, but world champs are blasted for meek response as ABs loom.
item.dc:creator: DUNCAN JOHNSTONE

item.title: New MIQ 'lobby' system a step into the unknown for Kiwis stranded overseas
item.description: A new system that aims to level the playing field is about to launch, but there are concerns the site could struggle with the demand.
item.dc:creator: SOPHIE CORNISH AND BENN BATHGATE

item.title: Neon's Scenes From a Marriage, Netflix's Sex Education among great shows to stream
item.description: A controversial '70s Swedish series gets a modern makeover and a popular British dramedy is back for a third season.
item.dc:creator: JAMES CROOT
